business.headline: Waaree Energies IPO: 10 things to know before subscribingWaaree Energies Limited (WEL), founded in 1990 and headquartered in Mumbai, is India's leading manufacturer and exporter of solar modules.

Hyundai IPO allotment tomorrow: Check final subscription, expected listing gainsHyundai Motor India IPO: The public issue was initially met with hesitation from investors, but by the close on Thursday, October 17, it had been subscribed more than twice.

Wipro Q2 results: IT firm announces 1:1 bonus share issue for shareholdersWipro reported a 21% increase in net profit, reaching Rs 3,209 crore for the quarter ending in September, compared to Rs 2,646 crore in the same period last year.

Infosys declares interim dividend of Rs 21 for shareholders. Check key details Infosys interim dividend: The Bengaluru-based IT giant has set October 29, 2024, as the record date, with the payout scheduled for November 8, 2024.

Wipro Q2 results: Net profit jumps 21% to Rs 3,209 croreWipro's consolidated revenue for the July-September quarter decreased by 1%, amounting to Rs 22,302 crore, down from Rs 22,543 crore in the same quarter the previous year.

Infosys Q2 results: Net profit up 5% to Rs 6,506 crore; Rs 21 dividend declaredInfosys Q2FY25 results: Revenue from operations for India's second-largest software services company also grew by 5% year-on-year, amounting to Rs 40,986 crore.
Sensex, Nifty end lower as auto stocks drive market correctionThe S&P BSE Sensex was down 494.75 points to close at 81,006.61, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 221.45 points to end at 24,749.85.

Sensex plunges over 500 points, Nifty below 25,000 amid market sell-offThe Sensex fell by 525.34 points, or 0.64%, at 80,976.02. Similarly, the Nifty dropped 222 points, or 0.89%, below the 25,000 mark at 24,749.30.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Hamas chief Yahya Sinwar killed in Gaza operation: Israel"Mass murderer Yahya Sinwar, who was responsible for the massacre and atrocities of October 7, was killed today by IDF soldiers," Israeli Foreign Minister Israel said in a statement.

Who was Yahya Sinwar, 'Butcher of Khan Younis', who plotted October 7 massacreHamas chief Yahya Sinwar was killed in an Israeli operation in Gaza, Israeli Foreign Minister Israel Katz said. From his hiding, Sinwar called for suicide attacks on Israeli targets. Infamous as the 'Butcher of Khan Younis', Sinwar masterminded the October 7 massacre in Israel. Earlier, he survived Israeli jails for 22 years.

S Jaishankar's Pak visit a start, would have loved if PM Modi came: Nawaz SharifFormer Pakistan's Prime Minister Nawaz Sharif hoped that with Jaishankar's visit to Islamabad, both India and Pakistan could put the past behind and tackle future problems like energy and climate change, among others.

Brave Rohit Sharma fronts up to face press after 46-all out in Bengaluru Test India vs New Zealand: Captain Rohit Sharma surprised quite a few by fronting up to the press after a horror day for India in the first Test. India were bowled out for 46 and they conceded a 134-run lead at Stumps in Bengaluru.

Will continue to...: Shiv Aroor responds to interference tag for Trudeau telecastJustin Trudeau does not like the truth, and particularly detests the truth that surrounds him in Canada right now, Shiv Aroor noted as his show has been flagged by Ottawa as 'foreign interference'.

What is the Bishnoi clan's code of conduct for apology and repentanceIf a person prefers to seek an apology from the Bishnoi community, it shall be conducted as per the 29 Niyamas (Code of Conduct) given by Guru Jambheshwar, the 16th-century founder of the Bishnoi Panth.

An Islamabad handshake, Bollywood comeback and cricket buzz: Hope for India-Pak?The optics of S Jaishankar agreeing to visit Pakistan amid tensions with Canada and shaking of hands and a brief conversation with Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif indicated the opening of a window of opportunity for further engagement.

'We're afraid he'll do something': Chilling 911 call before Liam Payne's fatal fallThe hotel manager made a 911 call moments before the fall, expressing growing concern over Liam Payne's erratic behaviour.

Rajasthan: The Royal Canvas for Dream WeddingsWhether it's the grandeur of a palace wedding in Udaipur, the mystique of a desert wedding in Jaisalmer, or the creativity of a themed wedding in Jaipur, Rajasthan offers a wedding experience that is truly out of the ordinary.

IIT Delhi's Technology & AI Leadership Programme: Shaping the Future of Tech LeadershipAdvance your career with IIT Delhi's Technology & AI Leadership Programme. Designed for aspiring tech leaders, this programme offers cutting-edge insights, practical experience, and strategic acumen to navigate the digital era. Gain the skills to drive innovation, lead digital transformations, and position yourself as a visionary in technology leadership.

Hoax threats to Indian flights traced to IP addresses in London, Germany: SourcesSources stated that the X handle, under probe, was created on Tuesday and used to post seven hoax messages that triggered major air security scares. The handle has since been suspended.

Lady Justice sheds blindfold, Sanjay Raut fails to seeThe new statue of Lady Justice in the Supreme Court library holding the Constitution without a blindfold is an attempt at projecting new imagery, shedding the colonial imprint. However, Shiv Sena's Sanjay Raut has gone ballistic with accusations, failing to see reason.

Asked Canada to extradite Lawrence Bishnoi gang members, got no response: IndiaMEA spokesperson Randhir Jaiswal said that similar extradition requests of syndicates linked to the Bishnoi gang were made recently as well, but Canada has not responded yet.

2 Bahraich violence accused shot during encounter while trying to flee to NepalAccused, Sarfaraz alias Rinku and Taleem were shot at during the encounter that broke out near the Handa Basehri Canal near the international border when they were trying to flee to Nepal.
Railways reduces advance ticket booking period to 60 days from NovemberFrom November 1, passengers will be able to book train tickets up to 60 days in advance, instead of the previous 120 days.

No evidence but egg on face. Canada's age-old problemJustin Trudeau went out on a limb to accuse India of a role in the killing of a Khalistani terrorist. He admitted there was intel but no evidence. The intelligence-to-evidence gap is a decades-old problem, stemming from Canadian police's excesses during the term of Trudeau's father, Pierre Trudeau.
Kangana Ranaut's Emergency gets censor certificate, release date announcement soonActor Kangana Ranaut announced that her film, Emergency, has been cleared by the censor board for screening.

Gehlot again! What's Congress's fascination with tired and retiredThe Congress, after humiliating setbacks in Haryana and Jammu and Kashmir, continues to rely on the same old leaders with questionable track records for upcoming elections in Maharashtra and Jharkhand. Despite promises to introspect, the party's fascination with the old guard is hard to fathom.

Why Israel might allow Iron Dome to miss some missilesLike doctors who had to make the cruel choice of letting some patients die during the Covid pandemic, Israel might have to pick which areas it wants to shield and which it doesn't from enemy missiles. With the cost of shooting down all missiles fired at residential areas taking a toll, Israel might have to make a cruel choice.

Salman Khan's ex Somy Ali's message for Lawrence Bishnoi: Can we talk?Salman Khan's ex and actor, Somy Ali, has invited gangster Lawrence Bishnoi for a Zoom call. Based in the US, Somy reached out to Lawrence, who is currently incarcerated at Sabarmati Central Jail, through a social media post.

India calls out Trudeau's cavalier behaviour after he admits to no proof on NijjarThe Ministry of External Affairs slammed Trudeau's handling of the situation, stating that Canada had failed to provide any evidence to support its allegations against India.

Video: Super Heavy engines light up to slow down the 200-ton rocketThe video, shot at an impressive 420 frames per second, reveals the sheer force required to slow down the massive 200-ton rocket as it approached the launch tower for a groundbreaking catch attempt.

Video: Priyanka Chopra turns heads in stylish grey mini dress at Mumbai eventPriyanka Chopra turned heads as she arrived at the launch of Max Factor in India. She stunned in a grey mini dress with cowled neckline and an attached train.

Suhana Khan to Ananya Panday: Celebs at Radhika Merchant's birthday bashRadhika Merchant's birthday bash was attended by Suhana Khan, Aryan Khan, Ananya Panday, Janhvi Kapoor, Ranveer Singh and MS Dhoni. Social media sensation Orry shared photos from the party.

Watch: Priyanka Chopra lets her hair down at Gateway of IndiaPriyanka Chopra returns to India, sharing a captivating video from the Gateway of India, much to the delight of her fans. With her Marathi film 'Paani' releasing soon, the actor continues to charm audiences worldwide.

Paris Has Fallen review: Thrilling action dampened by simplified storylineReleased-Fri Oct 18, 2024Paris Has Fallen review: Paris Has Fallen delivers thrilling action but falls short with its predictable storyline, featuring strong performances that try to compensate for its narrative shortcomings.

sports.headline: Clinical South Africa knock Australia out to avenge 2023 final defeat Women's T20 World Cup: South Africa beat Australia by eight wickets and stormed their way into the final of the tournament. The Proteas also defeated the Aussies for the first time in the history of the multi-nation championship.

New Zealand wanted to bat first, says Henry after Rohit admits misjudging pitchPacer Matt Henry admitted that New Zealand too would have batted first had they won the toss in the morning, something that must be music to the ears of Indian skipper Rohit Sharma.

Indian women's football team hammer Pakistan 5-2 in openerThe Indian women's football team kicked off their SAFF Women's Championship 2024 campaign with an impressive 5-2 win over Pakistan. Standout performances included Grace Dangmei's two goals and Bala Devi's milestone 50th international goal.

Dissecting India's 46-all out: Five ducks and quite a few tactical blunders India vs New Zealand, 1st Test: It was a rare off-day for India. The power-packed batting unit crumbled against a New Zealand bowling attack that enjoyed familiar conditions away from home in Bengaluru. After getting bowled out for 36, India allowed the visiting team to race to a position of strength on Day 2.

Mohammed Siraj-Devon Conway engage in banter: Chinnaswamy erupts with CSK chantsMohammed Siraj and Devon Conway engaged in a little banter during New Zealand's innings in Bengaluru. Conway scored a brilliant 91-run knock and missed out on a hundred.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
